body:
Thanks @doanduyhai and @jongyoul 

Kavin
MailTo: kavin.kumar@imaginea.com

@corneadoug 
My jira user name is meenakshisekar
Ping
@meenakshisekar I can't find you with this username

OOPS ! 
It is 
meenakshi.chandrasekar@imaginea.com
@Leemoonsoo Thanks for the review, I have provided some responses.

CI failure is irrelevant.
Tested, Merging it
Thanks @corneadoug!  :)
@Stefan9149 Do we still want to go forward with this PR?
@michrawson Could you split this PR in two?

@springml If we still want to continue this PR, there might be a few things to consider.
When running the whole paragraph, there is no specific paragraph running order. Depending on the interpreter used, some will start before others. Because of that, I'm not sure if this feature would really be functional.

@corneadoug Comment updated with original issue description.

The JIRA is already created: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-127

@doanduyhai Thanks, since it wasn't in the description, I didn't know
@Leemoonsoo Can I merge this?
Nice catch! I think it is better to fix CI failures in this PR since it will break CI if we merge this. I am willing to help you if you need any :)
Thank you @minahlee Please help me to solve PR problem.
Can you answer my question?
i didn't get the question. Can you please share it again ?
I left in-line comment on your PR. Don't you see it?
I've left my review in four days ago. But I misunderstood new Github's review system. I left my comment again as a singe comment. Can you see it?
Oh. Its' ok. now i see your comment.
Thanks for the contribution. I'll start review this PR.
I've no preference about adding some properties in a paragraph but you need to update docs for that feature in details.
@spektom thanks for the improvement. Can you also update`conf/zeppelin-env.sh.template` and `conf/zeppelin-site.xml.template` with env name/property name and description.
I just tested, bug is gone! LGTM

@r-kamath I've added documentation to the `zeppelin-env.sh.template` file, but I couldn't find any other option related to Livy interpreter in `zeppelin-site.xml.template`, so I've left this file untouched.
It looks like lens issue only. Can you change the title of this PR and Jira issue? Concerning the change, LGTM. Thanks for the contribution.
ping @AhyoungRyu @zjffdu
Merge if there is no more discussion
Changes look good to me
Changes look good to me
@ravwojdyla Can you add `docs/interpreter/scio.md` path below [this line](https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/master/docs/_includes/themes/zeppelin/_navigation.html#L68)?
On a request in #1471 from @jongyoul

@ravwojdyla I saw your last update. Thanks for your prompt response! 
Here is the list of dependencies from `mvn dependency:tree`. All of them will become part of the Zeppelin binary package. What needed to be done is 
- make sure that all these dependencies and the transitive dependencies as well
- have an appropriate licence, and are logged under the `./zeppelin-distribution/src/bin_license/LICENSE`
- and for non-Apache license, full text of the license need to be added to `./zeppelin-distribution/src/license/`

For your convenience I have listed all current dependencies of `scio` module below. You don't need to add all of the licenses listed in here. Many things are already existed. 


I've tested your branch, but it occurs another error. Could you please check it?

```
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-dependency-plugin:2.8:copy-dependencies (copy-dependencies) on project zeppelin-zengine: Artifact has not been packaged yet. When used on reactor artifact, copy should be executed after packaging
```

Do you have any idea?
@spektom I agree with you not to add zeppelin-env.\* because it depends on Live only.
How about removing Spark 1.1.\* and 1.2.\* in Zeppelin's support list? It's too old and even Apache Spark removed their download URL in their official web.
code rebase
Travis failure is unrelated and only on one of the build profile
Shell we have an entry for this change in [upgrading section](https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/master/docs/install/upgrade.md#upgrading-from-zeppelin-06-to-07)?
@Leemoonsoo sure. will update.
@minahlee Thank you for your effort!! :+1:

Thanks @mvitaly for the contribution!

Looks good to me!
LGTM
LGTM!
nice ! LGTM.
Tested on local, LGTM.

Thanks for the contribution.

How about let user set not only `HADOOP_CONF_DIR` but also `HADOOP_HOME` in conf/zeppelin-env.sh to use HDFS notebook storage?

Then hadoop dependencies in zeppelin-zengine can be provided scope, and that'll reduce binary package size. Also that'll allow user set different hadoop version without rebuild.

what do you think?

master branch runs 

```
val wbIPR=Array(8.40,      8.09,      7.56,      6.83,      5.88,      4.72,      3.36,      1.78,      0.0)
val pressureIPR=Array(0.00,10000000.00,20000000.00,30000000.00,40000000.00,50000000.00,60000000.00,70000000.00,80000000.00)
case class IPR (w:Array[Double],p:Array[Double])
val iprInit=IPR(wbIPR,pressureIPR)
val iprList=sc.parallelize((1.0 to 0.9 by -0.001).map(k => IPR(iprInit.w.map(_ * k), iprInit.p)).zipWithIndex,5)
iprList.count()
```

with out this patch. Do we still need this patch?
Ready to review
@Leemoonsoo 8f9006a

@corneadoug merged your PR.
Do you think now it is the good time to merge this one?
@Leemoonsoo  Just pushed the changes to make hadoop lib provided.

@doanduyhai I see. Thanks for the explanation.

Current master branch works with both scala-2.10 and scala-2.11 without rebuild, depending on which version of spark SPARK_HOME points. is displayUtils works in this way, too?
@AhyoungRyu sorry I missed it. Will go ahead and add all the licenses. Thanks!
@jongyoul, what about merging this as it is, and create another jira issue for removing Spark 1.1, 1.2 test and see how community think about removing it?
Merging it into branch-0.6
@Peilin-Yang Yes, you will need to rebase first though
Merging this directly as a hotfix

@Leemoonsoo That Jira issue is in Korean, could you update the PR description so that there is more details on what the problem is and what is the expected result of that test before and after the patch?
@corneadoug i've commented translation on the issue.
Thanks. LGTM and merge if there're no more discussions.
LGTM
LGTM
@AhyoungRyu Tested, LGTM!
@corneadoug Thanks! I retriggered CI just for sure. After checking CI then will merge this :)

@corneadoug 
sorry, could you please review for this pr?
Tested, it fixes the bug. Btw do we need this patch only in branch-0.6 not in master?

Hi @cloverhearts. Thanks for the improvement! I just tested and got some small feedbacks :) 1. Is there any particular reason to have dropdown menu next to the filter bar? If so, seems need to be sorted to alphabetic order i think ![screen shot 2016-10-06 at 2 43 29 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10060731/19141916/5d959250-8bd4-11e6-9e0c-d97e79372a23.png) 2. As you can see in the below gif image, there is latency after some typing. ![latency](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10060731/19141960/b941aeea-8bd4-11e6-8da4-b15b84cffd37.gif) We have a good example in Interpreter menu :) The search bar in interpreter menu, it shows the searched result right after typing. 3. The applied font in dropdown menu and the filter bar is different.
cool. will merge this if there are no more discussions
@AhyoungRyu Rebasing from master should fix the CI issue

Sorry I was running out of time too, and I decided to downgrade both Spark and Zeppelin versions, for which I was sure everything would have worked. I suggest to do the same.

Cheers,
Luca
Merging if there is no more discussion

@cloverhearts Just tested and checked the code.
Overall same feedbacks as @AhyoungRyu 

#### Filtering system

The one you used seems a bit too complicated (also the filter should have been in a new file).
Since it is also slow, using the same method used in interpreter search would be better.

#### Filtering input

Try to reuse the same as the interpreter search, it should have the proper font and keep the same style between pages.

#### Interpreter dropdown filtering

I would remove this feature mainly because it only works with the default interpreter.
Maybe also remove the default interpreter written on each job?

#### No results

Current message is: `Data does not exist`, `No Job found` would be better

#### Possible future work that could use a Jira issue
- Removing the legend (ready, finished, abort etc...), that info is already on each dot.
- Make Interpreter and Job page top part fixed, so that we can search even while scrolling

@jongyoul Thanks for your feedback! Yeah I didn't try to cover that case. So you mean we need to support ppl who are using [this upstart option](http://zeppelin.apache.org/docs/0.7.0-SNAPSHOT/install/install.html#optional-start-apache-zeppelin-with-a-service-manager), am I right? :)

@AhyoungRyu @corneadoug 
Thank you very much for your feedback.

#### Filtering system

I think the filter I added here actually will improve filtering performance since as soon as you press return key, it will show filtering result. And if there is no input from user for more than 2 sec, it stops filtering.

The reason I implemented filtering myself is to fix the latency issue with large number of notebooks. If you filter on every keydown event, it will freeze browser when you have a lot of notebooks.(tested with 250 notebooks). 

Will it be better if I add UI letting user know that they should press return button to complete filtering?

@corneadoug 
actually, I've used the interpreter filtering in the first implementation.
However, the behavior is a bit different from job filtering. So I had to define separate filters.

#### Filtering input and No results

Your opinion is right.
Okay, I will fix it.

#### Interpreter dropdown filtering

I think this feature is very important.
because currently there is no way to manage your interpreter which are not bound to notebook.
also, if you use a lot of notebooks and interpreter, I think users would want to see and sort it.
Personally I also wanted to have this kind of view when i was using cron scheduler to operating a notebook then can not find problem for interpreter bind.
I think this feature is a good way to be feedback to the user.

#### Possible future work that could use a jira issue

Yes, I agree with your opinion.
i will make a jira issue and implement those in future.

Thank you again.
Go for it

@Peilin-Yang Actually it's a bit hard for me to help since I can't rebase for you (Don't have the rights on your branch), but I can see that it is a pretty messy conflict you got.

For the Rebase process, you need to do a:

```
git fetch apache-github
git rebase apache-github/master
```

(apache-github being a remote for this official repo)

At the first round of conflicts on `paragraph.controller.js`, I would advise to copy paste the file from master, and replace your local file with conflict with it.
Then to copy paste the changes of your first commit into it (you can see the first commit diff [Here](https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/1492/commits/b92e92ff8821a58c47d7510818ec518414499c83))

After that first round, the other conflicts should be easier
